headline.main: A Card from Parson Brownlow--The Knoxvilla Whig.

docs.snippet: The tone for the day was given us this morning by the dispatch announcing the repulse of our gunboats from Fort Darling. The terms of the dispatch are probably needlessly alarming, as the document itself is unsatisfactory in details.

headline.main: OUR WASHINGTON CORRESPONDENCE.; HOW THE RUMOR OF THE REPULSE OF OUR GUNBOATS BELOW RICHMOND AFFECTS THE PUBLIC--GEN. HUNTER AND HIS EMANCIPATION ORDER--THE HERALD AND SEMATOR LANE, OF KANSAS--THE STATE TREASURER OF MISSOURI AND COL. JENNISON, ETC.

docs.lead_paragraph: The tone for the day was given us this morning by the dispatch announcing the repulse of our gunboats from Fort Darling. The terms of the dispatch are probably needlessly alarming, as the document itself is unsatisfactory in details.

LATER FROM NEWBERN.; Arrival of the Transport Gen. Burnside Nothing New of Interest Health of the Troops Good.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN FRANCE.; The Rumored Talk of Intervention in America The Cause of It M. Chevalier on Mexico The Acquittal of Mires, the Banker A Change in the School of Medicine.

docs.lead_paragraph: You will be naturally astonished to see in the European journals of this week, and especially in those of Paris and Brussels, a revival of the discussion on an intervention in American affairs. It is quite certain that there is not the least foundation for this new discussion on an obsolute question, and it may interest the reader to know how it was started.

headline.main: FROM THE MISSISSIPPI FLOTILLA.; Arrival of Capt. Davis and Departure of Commodore Foote Affecting Scenes on the Flagship Benton Late and Important From the South Brilliant Naval Engagement on the Mississippi Attack and Repulse of the Rebel Gunboat Fleet Injaries to the Gunboats Cincinnati and MoundCity, &c.
